title: World
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Two crucial Florida coral species left ‘functionally extinct’ by ocean heatwave
items.description: Climate crisis drives near-total collapse of staghorn and elkhorn corals that formed backbone to state’s reefs Two of the most important coral species...

items.title: World’s oldest serving head of state declared winner in Cameroon election
items.description: Paul Biya, 92, said to have won 53.66% of vote after volatile two weeks since election when opponent claimed victory Paul Biya, the world’s oldest ser...

items.title: Lithuanian PM says Belarus balloon incidents ‘call for united, resolute response,’ as it closes border with Russia’s ally – Europe live
items.description: Inga Ruginienė says ‘no hybrid attack will be tolerated’ and pledges to shoot down balloons after 66 objects spotted by radar overnight Meanwhile over...

items.title: Starmer condemns Farage for failing to take action against Reform MP’s ‘racist’ comments about black and Asian people – UK politics live
items.description: Farage repeatedly refuses to call Sarah Pochin’s remarks racist, saying they were ‘ugly, clumsy’ and should be taken in context of ‘DEI madness’ The G...

items.title: Republican Indiana governor calls  special session to redraw congressional maps
items.description: GOP-led state is latest that Trump administration has put pressure on to undertake redistricting to favor Republicans Indiana governor Mike Braun anno...

items.title: Prisons begin extra checks after migrant sex offender released in error
items.description: The government has introduced new mandatory procedures after the accidental release of Hadush Kebatu from Chelmsford prison on Friday.

items.title: Romanian grooming gang jailed for raping 10 women in Dundee
items.description: The four men and one woman plied their victims with drugs at various properties in Dundee.

items.title: Home Office squandered billions on asylum hotels, MPs say
items.description: "Flawed contracts" and "incompetent delivery" left the department unable to cope with demand for asylum accommodation, a report by MPs suggests.

items.title: Academic wins payout over portrayal in Steve Coogan's Richard III film
items.description: Richard Taylor sued Steve Coogan and two production companies over his portrayal in the movie.

items.title: North Sea oil and gas firm Petrofac files for administration
items.description: The energy services provider, which had been undergoing a financial restructuring, employs about 2,000 people in Scotland.
